title: How to Make Roses from Leaves

steps.headline: Consider the size and placement of the flowers before assembling the supplies.

steps.headline: Visualize the size of any arrangement you’d like to make.
steps.description:

steps.headline: Place the glued rolled leaf in the middle of the next leaf.
steps.description: Make sure the full leaf is facing upward with the rolled piece sitting directly in the middle (along the middle vein).

steps.headline: Fold the full leaf in half (backwards) and crease along the top of the rolled leaf.
steps.description: The rolled leaf should be sitting in the front (and center area) of the folded leaf.

steps.headline: Wrap the folded leaf around the rolled leaf.
steps.description: Grasp the right side of the folded leaf and roll it inward, toward the rolled leaf. Tuck underneath the other side of the bottom area of the rolled leaf and add a dab of hot glue.

steps.headline: Grab the left side of the folded leaf and roll it inward, in the opposite direction.
steps.description: Lay the end along the base of the other side of the leaf. Add a dab of hot glue to hold it in place.

steps.headline: Select another leaf and repeat the process by laying the rolled/folded leaf in the middle of the full leaf.

text:
Planning the Finished Product Consider the size and placement of the flowers before assembling the supplies. If you plan to design a bouquet, you will also need heavy wire wrapped with green florist tape to hold the roses together as a bunch. On the other hand, if you plan to just affix the flowers to fabric, a gift parcel or some other item, you may just need the leaves and hot glue. Visualize the size of any arrangement you’d like to make. Artificial leaves come in all shapes and sizes so you’ll need to plan how many and what sized leaves you’ll need. Take a count of how many flowers you plan to create. You will need approximately three leaves per flower. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7b/Make-Roses-from-Leaves-Step-1Bullet2.jpg/v4-459px-Make-Roses-from-Leaves-Step-1Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7b/Make-Roses-from-Leaves-Step-1Bullet2.jpg/v4-759px-Make-Roses-from-Leaves-Step-1Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Creating the Roses Fold one leaf in half. Run your thumb and index finger across the crease to ensure the leaf folds neatly and firmly. Hold the folded leaf on its side. Roll it downward into a tight roll. Keep a firm hold on the bottom and smooth it over as you roll downward. Add a few dabs of hot glue to the inside ends of the rolled leaf to hold the roll in place. Allow a few minutes for the glue to dry before using it. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2a/Make-Roses-from-Leaves-Step-6Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Make-Roses-from-Leaves-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2a/Make-Roses-from-Leaves-Step-6Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Make-Roses-from-Leaves-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Place the glued rolled leaf in the middle of the next leaf. Make sure the full leaf is facing upward with the rolled piece sitting directly in the middle (along the middle vein). Fold the full leaf in half (backwards) and crease along the top of the rolled leaf. The rolled leaf should be sitting in the front (and center area) of the folded leaf. Wrap the folded leaf around the rolled leaf. Grasp the right side of the folded leaf and roll it inward, toward the rolled leaf. Tuck underneath the other side of the bottom area of the rolled leaf and add a dab of hot glue. Grab the left side of the folded leaf and roll it inward, in the opposite direction. Lay the end along the base of the other side of the leaf. Add a dab of hot glue to hold it in place. Select another leaf and repeat the process by laying the rolled/folded leaf in the middle of the full leaf. Fold the leaf in half, backwards with the crease running along the top of the rolled/folded leaf. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/cb/Make-Roses-from-Leaves-Step-10Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Make-Roses-from-Leaves-Step-10Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/cb/Make-Roses-from-Leaves-Step-10Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Make-Roses-from-Leaves-Step-10Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Roll the sides inward, following the same way you folded/rolled the previous leaf but this time, bend the edges/ends outward so they resemble a flowering petal. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/85/Make-Roses-from-Leaves-Step-10Bullet2.jpg/v4-459px-Make-Roses-from-Leaves-Step-10Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/85/Make-Roses-from-Leaves-Step-10Bullet2.jpg/v4-759px-Make-Roses-from-Leaves-Step-10Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"
